verses.verse: And it came to pass after <WH310> these things <WH1697>, that the butler <WH8248> of the king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714> and his baker <WH644> had offended <WH2398> their lord <WH113> the king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714>.

And Pharaoh <WH6547> was angry <WH7107> against <WH5921> two <WH8147> of his officers <WH5631>, against the chief <WH8269> of the butlers <WH8248>, and against the chief <WH8269> of the bakers <WH644>.
And he put <WH5414> them in custody <WH4929> in the house <WH1004> of the captain <WH8269> of the guard <WH2876>, into the prison <WH1004>, the place <WH4725> where Joseph <WH3130> was bound <WH631>.
And the captain <WH8269> of the guard <WH2876> charged <WH6485> Joseph <WH3130> with them <WH8334>, and he served them <WH3117>: and they continued a season in prison <WH4929>.

And they dreamed <WH2492> a dream <WH2472> both of them <WH8147>, each man <WH376> his dream <WH2472> in one <WH259> night <WH3915>, each man <WH376> according to the interpretation <WH6623> of his dream <WH2472>, the butler <WH8248> and the baker <WH644> of the king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714>, which were bound <WH631> in the prison <WH1004>.
And Joseph <WH3130> came in <WH935> unto them in the morning <WH1242>, and looked <WH7200> upon them <WH2196>, and, behold, they were sad.

And he asked <WH7592> Pharaoh <WH6547>'s officers <WH5631> that were with him in the custody <WH4929> of his lord <WH113>'s house <WH1004>, saying <WH559>, Wherefore look <WH6440> you so sadly <WH7451> to day <WH3117>?

And they said <WH559> unto him <WH2492>, We have dreamed a dream <WH2472>, and there is no interpreter <WH6622> of it <WH3130>. And Joseph said <WH559> unto them <WH6623>, Do not interpretations belong to God <WH430>? tell me them <WH5608>, I pray you.
And the chief <WH8269> butler <WH8248> told <WH5608> his dream <WH2472> to Joseph <WH3130>, and said <WH559> to him <WH2472>, In my dream, behold <WH1612>, a vine was before me <WH6440>;

And in the vine <WH1612> were three <WH7969> branches <WH8299>: and it was as though it budded <WH6524>, and her blossoms <WH5322> shot forth <WH5927>; and the clusters <WH811> thereof brought forth ripe <WH1310> grapes <WH6025>:

And Pharaoh <WH6547>'s cup <WH3563> was in my hand <WH3027>: and I took <WH3947> the grapes <WH6025>, and pressed <WH7818> them into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s cup <WH3563>, and I gave <WH5414> the cup <WH3563> into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s hand <WH3709>.
And Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> unto him <WH6623>, This is the interpretation of it <WH7969>: The three branches <WH8299> are three <WH7969> days <WH3117>:

Yet <WH5750> inside three <WH7969> days <WH3117> shall Pharaoh <WH6547> lift up <WH5375> your head <WH7218>, and restore <WH7725> you unto your place <WH3653>: and you shall deliver <WH5414> Pharaoh <WH6547>'s cup <WH3563> into his hand <WH3027>, after the former <WH7223> manner <WH4941> when you were his butler <WH8248>.

But think <WH2142> on me when it shall be well <WH3190> with you and show <WH6213> kindness <WH2617>, I pray you unto me <WH2142>, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh <WH6547>, and bring me <WH3318> out of this house <WH1004>:
For indeed I was stolen away <WH1589> out of the land <WH776> of the Hebrews <WH5680>: and here also have I done <WH6213> nothing <WH3972> that they should put <WH7760> me into the dungeon <WH953>.

When the chief <WH8269> baker <WH644> saw <WH7200> that the interpretation <WH6622> was good <WH2896>, he said <WH559> unto Joseph <WH3130>, I also <WH637> was in my dream <WH2472>, and <WH7969>, behold, I had three white <WH2751> baskets <WH5536> on my head <WH7218>:

And in the uppermost <WH5945> basket <WH5536> there was of all manner <WH3978> of baked food <WH4639> for Pharaoh <WH6547>; and the birds <WH5775> did eat <WH398> them out of the basket <WH5536> upon <WH5921> my head <WH7218>.
And Joseph <WH3130> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>, This is the interpretation <WH6623>: The three <WH7969> baskets <WH5536> are three <WH7969> days <WH3117>:

Yet inside three <WH7969> days <WH3117> shall Pharaoh <WH6547> lift up <WH5375> your head <WH7218> from off you and shall hang <WH8518> you on a tree <WH6086>; and the birds <WH5775> shall eat <WH398> your flesh from off you <WH1320>

And it came to pass the third <WH7992> day <WH3117>, which was Pharaoh <WH6547>'s birthday <WH3117>, that he made <WH6213> a feast <WH4960> unto all his servants <WH5650>: and he lifted up <WH5375> the head <WH7218> of the chief <WH8269> butler <WH8248> and of the chief <WH8269> baker <WH644> among <WH8432> his servants <WH5650>.
And he restored <WH7725> the chief <WH8269> butler <WH8248> unto his butlership <WH4945> again <WH7725>; and he gave <WH5414> the cup <WH3563> into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s hand <WH3709>:
But he hanged <WH8518> the chief <WH8269> baker <WH644>: as Joseph <WH3130> had interpreted to them <WH6622>.
Yet did not the chief <WH8269> butler <WH8248> remember <WH2142> Joseph <WH3130>, but forgot him <WH7911>.
